title.narrative: FLA Project: Mother & Child Health and Nutrition (MCHN), Targeted and Blanked Supplementary Feeding Porgrams (TSFP & BSFP) in Refugee Settlements

description.narrative: Since 2014 in Kiryandongo and 2016 in Bidibidi settlements, Action Against Hunger has supported the establishment of curative and preventive nutrition programs for South Sudanese refugees. These interventions have been implemented in partnership with the respective district local governments and contribute towards improvements in the nutrition and health situation by: supporting local district health systems to provide curative and preventive services for acute malnutrition, building capacity of community structures to detect, manage and prevent under nutrition; improving access to safe water, and hygiene and health practices in targeted communities; and promoting dietary diversification for vulnerable households through increased access to resources and technologies for production (income generating activities).

The project focuses on targeting children and pregnant and lactating women with targeted supplementary feeding programming (TSFP) and maternal and child health and nutrition programming (MCHN). The organization will distribute specialized nutritious foods and manage food stores and stocks at health facilities. Additionally, it will build the capacity of caregivers (women and men)) in prevention, identification, and management of MAM (Management of Acute Malnutrition) and MCHN, alongside the support of health facilities to manage the same. The project also provides for the training of Village Health teams on case finding and the promotion of good Infant and Young Child Feeding (IYCF). Action Against Hunger will provide gender sensitive nutrition and health education/sensitization during food and cash distribution, community meetings, and nutrition counseling.
